channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title:
Mo Farah, the first British track and field athlete to win four Olympic gold medals, said that he had been trafficked to the UK as a child under a false name.
“Most people know me as Mo Farah, but it’s not my name, or it’s not the reality,” he said. https://t.co/ZjTz87vGZF https://t.co/SJWZQYRAhV

About 4,000 beagles were rescued from a breeding and research facility in Virginia that broke regulations and left the animals underfed, ill and injured.
Now the authorities have about two months to find the dogs new homes. https://t.co/8Bm8G65IJb https://t.co/osrYYpr6lr

Elon Musk has eroded trust in Twitter, walloped employee morale, spooked potential advertisers, emphasized its financial difficulties and spread misinformation about how the company operates. https://t.co/UUa2GiiTZH https://t.co/6PdTv0I1PW
President Biden revealed the first image from the Webb Space Telescope, the deepest view yet into our universe’s past, NASA said. https://t.co/Jxi1oe8ECM https://t.co/ElDSlqeN72

Midway through the 2022 primary season, Democratic lawmakers and officials are venting their frustrations with President Biden’s struggle to advance the bulk of his agenda, viewing him as an anchor that should be cut loose in 2024. https://t.co/0D3j3i40CJ https://t.co/F5XpGB12Lf
Elon Musk disparaged Twitter’s executives, ridiculed its content policies, complained about the product and confused its more than 7,000 employees with his pronouncements. https://t.co/875pBCi4sa

Hundreds marched with family members of the 19 children and two teachers slain in the massacre at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas, to demand answers about why it took officers more than an hour to confront the gunman. https://t.co/1b0lmkScOi https://t.co/R67BuYTFEV

The current generation of Brazilian surfers is so dominant, so undeniable, that it has earned a nickname: Tempestade Brasileira, which is Portuguese for the Brazilian Storm. Here's how they became so good. https://t.co/aWi1pnUM2C https://t.co/QgrtF2Ym1t

A wildfire in Yosemite National Park is threatening a grove of hundreds of giant sequoia trees that is home to some of the longest-living and tallest trees in the world. With smoke expected to drift west, the Bay Area is under an air quality advisory. https://t.co/9UICREAcUK https://t.co/0IYjfauG14

Gregory Robinson was enjoying another job when NASA persuaded him to take on the James Webb Space Telescope Program, an enormous astronomy project that was billions of dollars over budget and years behind schedule. https://t.co/q7N890kGLg
Breaking News: President Biden revealed the first image from the Webb Space Telescope, the deepest view yet into our universe’s past, NASA said. https://t.co/vp00qyqNB6 https://t.co/13aMd4b7KQ

President Biden is facing an alarming level of doubt from inside his own party, with 64% of Democratic voters saying they would prefer their party to have a different candidate in the 2024 campaign, according to a New York Times/Siena College poll. https://t.co/RqrqCsX1eq https://t.co/G9LXwBGrFq

NASA picked five new images of scenes captured by the James Webb Space Telescope from around the universe that it hopes will knock the public’s socks off. Get ready for astronomical records to be broken. https://t.co/cTEuFdt0nh https://t.co/3wXNeZwTDl

"I kept waiting for someone to come. But when I didn’t see anyone coming in, I just thought, nobody’s coming."
A teacher who survived the mass shooting in Uvalde, Texas, recounts the harrowing attack and desperate wait for a rescue. https://t.co/gHjFPPubiZ

"I want my daughter back. If I can’t have her, then those who failed her will never know peace." Relatives of the slain children and teachers in Uvalde, Texas, are expressing their frustration through protest. https://t.co/GOhkV5qpDc

NASA will show off the first pictures and data from the new James Webb Space Telescope on Tuesday. The images constitute a sightseeing tour of the universe painted in colors no human eye has seen. https://t.co/EvQJdDSTqh

WNBA players wore jerseys with Brittney Griner’s name and number during the league’s All-Star Game to honor Griner, who has been detained in Russia.
“We are not going to stop until everyone understands how serious this really is,” one player said. https://t.co/UGytZ4Pmxq https://t.co/iDp67CJ2X6

Several states run by Democrats are pushing for stiffer rules on the spread of false information, while Republican-run states are pushing for fewer rules. In this deeply polarized era, even the fight for truth breaks along partisan lines. https://t.co/AkSl6ATt20

Croydon is a town of 800 people in New Hampshire, where the state motto is, "Live Free or Die." When a motion passed at a low-turnout meeting to cut the school budget in half, it jolted the community to realize what it had taken for granted: democracy. https://t.co/0CfXNPs0KW

President Biden is hemorrhaging support, with only 26% of Democratic voters saying the party should renominate him in 2024, a New York Times/Siena College poll found. Voters nationwide gave him a meager 33% job approval rating. https://t.co/OMwNkcclrr
The House Jan. 6 committee rushed Cassidy Hutchinson's explosive testimony for two crucial reasons: intense pressure from Trump allies, and a fear of leaks. https://t.co/ZLsjOXFRya

Gov. Doug Ducey of Arizona signed a measure into law that makes it illegal for people to record videos within eight feet of police activity. Civil rights and news media organizations have objected to the law as a violation of free speech protections. https://t.co/umEDOC9teF

"Lifting gave me a sense of agency. It gave me a sense of control."
Everyone knows that weight lifting increases physical strength. But, for some, it can give psychological power, too. https://t.co/XwhQBNKY33
The new FX show "The Bear," streaming on Hulu, is one of the most vivid, authentic portrayals of what it’s like to work in food service. https://t.co/kkANixEjVh

More than 300 new independent bookstores have sprouted across the U.S. in the past couple of years, in a surprising revival after an early pandemic slump. The book selling business — traditionally overwhelmingly white — has also become much more diverse. https://t.co/AFkAqasvP5

NASA picked five new images of scenes from around the universe that it hopes will knock the public’s socks off. Get ready for astronomical records to be broken. https://t.co/LDUYEtGzKb https://t.co/uCl7z8SaSg
Breaking News: Novak Djokovic defeated Nick Kyrgios in the Wimbledon final to win his 21st Grand Slam single title. https://t.co/rHqJl1JK90

Breaking News: Steve Bannon has agreed to testify before the Jan. 6 panel in a remarkable about-face days before his contempt of Congress trial is set to begin. https://t.co/aNyYmcWNzB https://t.co/8zbjGYOzcI
President Biden is eyeing a second term. But at 79, he’s testing the boundaries of age and the presidency, a sensitive topic in the West Wing. https://t.co/u1vwh10OXt https://t.co/4MmobieSEW

Influenced by feminists close to him, the chief of Mexico's Supreme Court helped pave the way for decriminalization of abortion.
"Some of us are in favor of the life of women being one in which their dignity is respected," he said. https://t.co/H9vOsOdrA6 https://t.co/8PJYLSiuuj

One early indicator of memory issues, according to neuroscientist Dr. Richard Restak, is giving up on fiction. He has noticed that fiction requires patients to actively engage with the text.
Here are his other tips for how to prevent memory decline. https://t.co/LAXIaY7Prh

In Opinion
Donald Trump "betrayed his oath to defend the Constitution, and it was to the detriment of me, my colleagues and all Americans, whom he was supposed to protect," writes Aquilino Gonell, a Capitol Police officer who was injured on Jan. 6. https://t.co/3EZhmMvJWG

Ivan Dorn, a pop star was born in Russia and grew up in Ukraine, promoted friendship between the two nations for years. Now, he has cut ties with Moscow and is raising money to help Ukrainians in peril. https://t.co/TifNREbIVW
Breaking News: President Gotabaya Rajapaksa of Sri Lanka has agreed to resign, an ally said, after protesters, furious over economic turmoil, stormed his home. https://t.co/xAt856Lvtq

"I’m tired of this separation of church and state junk," Rep. Lauren Boebert, a Republican from Colorado, said to applause from congregants in a church. She's part of a wave of right-wing politicians aiming to promote Christian power in America. https://t.co/yYgMdPbXrv

As President Biden insists he plans to run for a second term, his age has increasingly become an uncomfortable issue for him and his party. Polls show many Americans consider him too old, and some Democratic strategists do not think he should run again. https://t.co/OxncGGcbL4

Despite major policy disagreements, Democratic donors are backing Liz Cheney in Wyoming’s upcoming Republican primary because of her role on the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 attack. https://t.co/tVrX1gCWEO

President Gotabaya Rajapaksa of Sri Lanka agreed to step down after what appeared to be one of the largest protests yet, following months of demonstrations fueled by the nation’s economic crisis. https://t.co/uhalnevBtD https://t.co/wIOMB2MeU3

More than 1,000 people gathered in front of the White House, with hundreds risking arrest by sitting at the building’s gates, as they urged President Biden to take more federal action to protect abortion rights. https://t.co/cbpvC7AHga https://t.co/ocUwmJh9IO

Gov. Doug Ducey of Arizona signed a measure into law that makes it illegal for people to record videos within eight feet of police activity. Civil rights and news media organizations have objected to the law as a violation of free speech protections. https://t.co/Zv0s0Pydml

A New York Times investigation into a Bronx apartment fire in January that killed 17 people found that the deaths were preventable. Deadly smoke filled all 19 stories when the fire safety system failed disastrously. https://t.co/b0DeCt4U4Q

Hundreds of people lined up at a makeshift memorial in Nara, Japan, to pay their respects to Shinzo Abe, the country’s longest serving prime minister. He was assassinated there on Friday while speaking at a political rally. https://t.co/pH9UTtm1OC https://t.co/JpBp2Z2gyS

Breaking News: Elena Rybakina, a Russian-born player representing Kazakhstan, beat Ons Jabeur of Tunisia in three sets to win the Wimbledon singles title. https://t.co/QJ4pcJnpCy https://t.co/aUu89WAIzH

The JROTC program has often become a place where retired military officers prey on teenage students, a New York Times investigation found. In the past five years, at least 33 instructors were criminally charged with sexual misconduct involving students. https://t.co/wJU32nl5Br https://t.co/ivgfOOEgcE

Demonstrators entered the residence of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa of Sri Lanka on Saturday, amid large protests over the country’s economic crisis. The country's political leaders have asked him to step down. https://t.co/R2N2OQLhZ9 https://t.co/3tgR68dfDU

The prime minister of Sri Lanka announced that he will quit. President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has been asked by the country’s political leaders to also step down after months of protests accusing him of running the economy into the ground. https://t.co/yMTAPxaWCv

Memory decline is not inevitable with aging, neuroscientist Dr. Richard Restak argues in his latest book. Here are some of his tips for developing and maintaining a healthy memory. https://t.co/QyFr9cuUiy
Tin Chin and Mo Lin were inseparable at the Brooklyn homeless shelter where they met. But one of the men wasn’t who he seemed to be. https://t.co/cI1Q151BHw

Breaking News: Protesters in Sri Lanka entered the president’s home as thousands descended on the capital amid fury over a devastating economic crisis.
https://t.co/V2uiX1GnyD

A judge in Britain sided with Prince Harry in his defamation suit against the tabloid newspaper, The Mail on Sunday. The ruling, part of an initial phase of Harry's libel case, found parts of the article to be defamatory. https://t.co/KDku3YyG6z
